data.body:
Straits Chinese Restaurant is located at Cecil Street, Straits Chinese Nonya Restaurant is one of three establishments by Guan Hoe Soon, the oldest Nonya Restaurant in Singapore, located in Singapore's Central Business District area since 1984.

Using secret recipes handed down through the generations, the restaurant offers a wide selection of dishes that maintain the original taste of an Authentic Peranakan cuisine, using only the freshest ingredients and spices. Straits Chinese Nonya Restaurant is part of a restaurant list featured in Michelin Guide Singapore.

reviews.text:
Lovely places with nice interior and music. Clean and tidy place.

The in-charge was very friendly and polite despite my repeated changes of timing. Their foods definitely authentic and serving hot.

The staffs very welcoming and served efficient.

Good environment if you planning to do cosy events for family together.

Thumbs up to this company.

I’ve been dining & catering numerous occasions & they have never failed my expectations in terms of food & services.
Excellent services by the management and staff.
Awesome yummy delicious Nonya cuisine.
Keep it up the great & wonderful food & services rendered!
I have visited the restaurant twice for now. The standard of food is very well maintained. Presentation is superb and food is extremely delicious! Highly recommended!
Food was excellent. It’s been a long time since I had such a delicious Peranakan food. Bravo to the chef team !

The best nonya restaurant when considering these factors: authenticity, flavour, customer service, ambience, and value for money. Would definitely come back for more! Special mention that their staff and lady boss are all very nice people. Overall experience feels homey and heartwarming. Very rare experience in a restuarant nowadays.

data.description: Straits Chinese Restaurant
data.name: Straits Chinese Restaurant

data.body: Jia Wei Chinese Restaurant

reviews.text: Excellent food and of high quality… taste of home cooked food and are priced very reasonably and affordable. Really good value for money.
Not as good as expected. Customer service definitely needs significant investment. Will appreciate some honesty there.

We had the seasonal hairy crab set and really enjoyed it! The serving staff informed us that we’d be served the soup as the crabs are being steamed. The crabs were big, sweet and juicy. The bonus was they were expertly dismantled just sufficiently for our enjoyment. While the dishes were not classic hairy crab ones served by other Chinese restaurants, the ones we had were full of flavour cos of the fresh ingredients and thoughtful preparation. To complement the yin of the hairy crabs, ginger tea and a ginger peach gum dessert were served.

Can always count on Jia Wei to deliver a good meal, be it lunch or dinner. Their sweet and sour pork, tofu with luffa melon, and crab meat fried rice are among our favorite dishes. Their bento meals on Grab (if still available) are very value for money! Can't wait to visit the restaurant in person!
The food is fantastic! Staffs are friendly and accomodating. Highly recommended!

data.description: Jia Wei Chinese Restaurant
data.name: Jia Wei Chinese Restaurant

data.body:
Established since 12 July 1990, the award-winning Xin Cuisine Chinese Restaurant brings you the finest Cantonese delicacies and intricate dim sums crafted by a team of Master Chefs. Loved by locals and guests alike, its signature Homestyle Roast Duck with Tea Leaves and Poached Rice with Seafood in Superior Broth served with Crispy Rice are not to be missed. Intimate private dining rooms are also available for business or social gatherings.

SIGNATURE DISHES
- Xin's Signature Home-style Roast Duck with Tea Leaves
- Deep-fried Prawns coated with Yuzu Mayonnaise
- Stir-fried Wagyu Beef Cubes with Black Pepper and Longan
- Poached Rice with Seafood in Superior Broth served with Crispy Rice

DIM SUM BUFFET
Indulge in perennial favourites such as Steamed Barbecued Pork Bun, Custard Bun with Salted Egg Yolk, Shrimp Dumpling with Fish Roe (Har Kow) and tantalize your taste buds with Xin's selection of soup, noodle/congee, dessert. Available from Wednesdays to Fridays, lunch only.

WEDDINGS AT XIN CUISINE
Xin Cuisine Chinese Restaurant is a prestige venue for small intimate weddings with an award-winning spread that will satisfy your gastronomic pleasures.

reviews.text: Overall,"it is a good dining experience with delicious food. Staff are great and take pride in what they do. They offered to clean up the table after our dinner before having our dessert as well. Carmen is specially attentive and provide excellent service to us. We will come back again.

Very good dinning experience as my family of five was here for lunch. Carmen who is the Asst manager is always on the look out for my elderly uncle and ensured he could dine comfortably here by offering him a comfy chair and watch out on his dining needs cutlery. Very fabulous food and will be back again. Excellent Service highly recommended!

Xin is a fine Chinese restaurant that serves good food and excellent service. They serve one of the best quality dim sum. Thank you Carmen, Fanny and May for always making your guests comfortable and welcomed.
Good food at the restaurant, very spacious environment, nice ambience and good service from the staff. Food is well presented, taste good too. Thank you.
The food is delicious, price is affordable.

data.description: Awarding-winning Cantonese Cuisine with Intricate Dim Sum
data.name: XIN CUISINE CHINESE RESTAURANT

data.body:
Discover modern Cantonese cuisine in a Chinese restaurant like no other. Located where Bugis Street meets Bras-Basah in one of Singapore’s more authentic areas, Song Garden gives you an unforgettable taste of the city’s culinary excellence. Our skillful chefs have elaborated a mouth-watering array of contemporary dishes. Pleasing to the eye, exquisite on the tastebuds – expect a dash of wow factor in each and every one. The setting is elegant. Filled with daylight at lunchtime, cozy when night falls, the main restaurant and six private dining rooms feature traditional Chinese furnishings and paintings. Ideal for banquets and business lunches in Singapore.

Weekdays Lunch: 11.30am to 2.30pm

Dinner: 6pm to 10pm

Weekends/ Public Holiday Lunch: 11am to 3pm

Dinner: 6pm to 10pm

reviews.text: Great quality Cantonese dishes. My wife and I had our Chinese New Year dinner there today . The restaurant did not disappoint.  The service was excellent as the staff was very attentive to our needs all the time.  I would have given 5 stars if the chef improved on the food presentation. Overall a great experience and recommend it to others.

Today, I went to the restaurant in Song Garden to eat. The food is very good and the service attitude is very good. I am very happy to have dinner here today. This restaurant was recommended by my friend. My friend said that there is a dish recommended by a male manager, which is very good. So this is the first time to dine here. Makes me very happy
nice and tasty food speed of serving need improvment . A FINE DINNING PLACE . VALUE FOR MONIES

We really enjoyed our lunch at Song Garden today. The dim sum were great, surrounded by friendly service staff and nice environment. Special thanks to Mr. William and Ms. Carol for their excellent services and we recommend this restaurant and will definitely come back again.
My boss brought us here for lunch... Nice dim sum and food ..my favourite is the pumpkin lobster soup.... Lobster was fresh and portion was good. Will come again.

data.description: Modern Cantonese Cuisine

address.buildingName: Song Garden, Level 2, Mercure Singapore Bugis

data.name: SONG GARDEN CHINESE RESTAURANT

data.body: Hwang Sil serves Korean and Chinese cuisine. They offer Boiled Dumplings, Shredded Pork with Sauce, Sweet & Sour Pork and many more. Come and enjoy their delicious dishes with your friends and family!

reviews.text: Nothing really fantastic in my opinion. I tried Set A with fried dumpling, sweet sour pork, black bean sauce noodles and seafood soup noodles. Dumpling is quite tasty but overall I feel that the food is only average. Service is still good. Price is on the high side. Sweet sour pork smallest is $28. Wanted to try jelly fish salad but it’s $38. In my opinion only worth going once to try, unlikely to return again.

Visited the place for two times, and still amazed by how well-executed the noodles were!!! The noodles got a nice chew and very tasty! Most of the customers visited during lunch hour were Korean! I recommend Jjamppong the most!

Went down today and reach before 2pm but was closed. Website stated 3pm. I asked the staff if they are open as the website stated 3pm, she just said today just closed early. 😆 win liao.... can happy happy closed whatever time they please so call to check before making the trip

Jjamppong(짬뽕) and raw beef(육회) are the best in Singapore.
Other menus are also above average.
I had jjamppong, sweet&sour pork and kimchi pancake. It is really delicious. Totally addicted to the sweet&sour pork.

data.description: Description
data.name: Hwang Sil Korean Chinese Restaurant

data.body: Just as the name of the restaurant suggests, Oriental Chinese Restaurant offers only the most authentic and best of Northeastern and Sichuan cuisine. Beyond just the food, the  friendly staff as well the warmth of the ambience will make you feel at home. If you're looking for a place to relax with family and friends after work over good food, Oriental Chinese Restaurant is the perfect choice!

reviews.text: Had a wonderful meal yesterday with my drinking khakis. Food is nice and cheap. Although they are busy, they still keep to their service standards. Will come back again to try other dishes

Always crowded but they have many shops around. A wide variety of Chinese food with reasonable price. The portion is big and recommend to come with a group of friends so can order more food. Must order 辣子雞。it was yummy. Love their appetisers too. 5 of us and we ordered 14 items. Truly enjoyed the food and it wasn’t costly. If you are around Chinatown, must visit this shop. Total bill is $133.30 with 2 beers, tea and warm water.

Come here on a weekly basis. The sweet and sour fish is a must order! Super crispy and sweet. Their skewers are not the only ones that taste great, other dishes are reasonably priced and taste amazing!
Good food but atrocious service. Do visit if you want to pay for their bad attitude

They used to be good. But, one, they started to crimp on ingredients. Two, they don’t speak English. Three, they will forget order items if you take away and don’t check.

If you have someone fluent in Chinese in your group, you can get OK food for good value. If not, this place is a question mark.

data.description: Description
data.name: Oriental Chinese Restaurant 东北美食

data.body: From the ambience to the food options, this eatery will keep you steeped in local Chinese culture with authentic dishes.

reviews.text: We were served by Alexis, and she was nothing short of amazing. She was very friendly, recommended is good options as well. Food was great too. 10/10 would come again.
Awesome food. Luxurious portion.  Alexis      attentive & know products well. Also a warm person. GEMS standard 👍👍👍👍👍
Excellent service from waitress Alexis. Food was tasty and the portion was generous. Would recommend and would come again.

Went over restaurant week. Excellent platter that two of us could barely finish (i think we didn't!) and could barely walk afterwards! Very generous helping, the food quality (scallops, mussels, salmon, ribs, prawns) is excellent, very pleasantly surprised having walked in without expectations.

The cakes that came with the set were also delicious and a very generous portion.

The owner came by and had a chat with us, as well as all the patrons of the restaurant. The wait staff is warm and friendly. The atmosphere is pretty quiet, but such warm engagements encourage you to return! (they also gave us extra cake, because it was nearly closing...)

Prices slightly on the higher side, but the food is delicious, the quality is excellent, and would be happy to recommend this to others.

I had lunch here with my family and our server Alexis provided an exceptional service. Drinks were served promptly and the food was delicious. I recommend the Chicken rice or the Kobe Beef Char Kway Teow. The portion were huge. Overall great experience and will come back. Thank you Alexis and the fortune cookie team!

data.description: Authentic Halal Chinese Restaurant in Kampong Gelam
data.name: The Fortune Cookie

data.body: Experience the Sichuan- Chinese dish loved by locals, Mala Xiang Guo. Caution: Mala translates to spicy and numbing, so come prepared!

reviews.text: Big portion rice bowls, the felafel & pulled meat are best. Yamn balls were a surprise delight, you should try!
Super delicious halal Mala cuisine as good as you can get from original country. The fish dish is EPIC
Thumbs Up......will be back more to get every dish that put on my table....will highly recommended .......My big compliment to LE FUSE TEAM ......Great Service n Superb FOOD....
Beef noodles is so delicious both Mala spicy & non-spicy for me. THank u to the chef & service staff is nice & friendly. Its halal restaurant. Its well recommended :)
Definitely a place to enjoy Mala food. Ingenious menu. Tried the Alaskan King Crab dish, the tomato egg dish is amazing.

data.description: Halal Chinese food in Kampong Gelam
data.name: Le Fuse

data.body: Formerly known as Chinois, this Chinese fine dining restaurant at Hotel Michael™ sees celebrity chef Susur Lee’s signature contemporary Chinese dishes sharing the spotlight with senior executive chef Ken Ling’s fiery Hunanese and Teochew delights. The signature Roast London Duck, with its crispy aromatic skin and succulent duck meat, is a must-order. Visitors should also try the restaurant’s Singapore Slaw, chef Susur’s twist on the local yusheng salad that is traditionally eaten during Chinese New Year. Vegetarian menus are available in the restaurant, which also has three private rooms that can seat four to 12 for groups who prefer private dining.

reviews.text: A rather underrated place that serves authentic local Chinese cuisine! Fried rice was one of the best I've had and the seafood here is a must try! Prawns are so succulent and fresh and cooked in a delicious sauce. Drooling just from writing this review. Definitely a must to check out!

A restaurant with CNY set menu which is value for money for a family of four. Service was great as they listen to customer request when making reservation. During our meal, staff was attentive and responsive. The food was very fufilling for our family. My personal choice is the soup and deep fried fish. Both dishes taste excellent. We are considering our next year option again in this restaurant.
Superb quality of food. Tastes great 👍! Not packed on a weekday, but reservations preferred. Daily 50% discounts for premium seafood. Pricey but really enjoyable ambience and food.
Fresh seafood. Great food. Vegetarian option available. Pricy but does have quite some discount offers available.

Tunglok Heen set meal offers quality great tasting food at reasonable prices. Dishes were well done and seafood were fresh. The champagne was great too.  Sapporo beer of course mai trains a great cold o e standard that went along well with the food.  Recommended eat!!

data.description: This Chinese fine dining restaurant dishes out Chinese, Hunanese and Teochew delights.

address.buildingName: Resorts World™ Sentosa, Hotel Michael Lobby

data.name: Tunglok Heen

data.body: Muslim-owned Chinese eatery serving up Sichuan cuisine.

reviews.text: Big portion rice bowls, the felafel & pulled meat are best. Yamn balls were a surprise delight, you should try!
Super delicious halal Mala cuisine as good as you can get from original country. The fish dish is EPIC
Thumbs Up......will be back more to get every dish that put on my table....will highly recommended .......My big compliment to LE FUSE TEAM ......Great Service n Superb FOOD....
Beef noodles is so delicious both Mala spicy & non-spicy for me. THank u to the chef & service staff is nice & friendly. Its halal restaurant. Its well recommended :)
Definitely a place to enjoy Mala food. Ingenious menu. Tried the Alaskan King Crab dish, the tomato egg dish is amazing.

data.description: Muslim-owned Chinese eatery serving up Sichuan cuisine.
data.name: Le Fuse Cafe

data.body: Offering a taste of nostalgia, 8 Noodles is set in a 1960s style restaurant setting. Offering diners an assortment of affordably priced noodles, this cosy restaurant also serves traditional Cantonese-style roast meats.

reviews.text: I never had Singaporean food before. Waitress was very friendly and helpful in making recommendation with good explanation.  Balcony is good place to sit especially around sunset time as there is not to noisy from pool area and view if very nice with greenery around and colorful sunset
We all like the crispy skin of that roast pork.
Great authentic noodles, and a little bit better cost-wise than the other resort restaurants. If you want to budget you have to get off the island.

Went here for lunch on a Sunday and enjoyed our experience. From the Chinese styled menu, the wanton noodle soup the highlight, which was just  outstanding. Service was fast with the restaurant having both indoor and outdoor seating. A great part of the Shangri-La Rasa Sentosa so worth checking out during your stay.
Definitely suggest ordering their kway tiaw. It's really chewy and flavorful. The prawns are substantial and crunchy, while the sausages are rich. The Hakka noodles were also great.

data.companyDisplayName: Shangri-La's Rasa Sentosa Resort & Spa, Singapore
data.description: A Chinese noodle house in a 1960s setting.
data.name: 8 Noodles

data.body: Core to the Tea Chapter philosophy is appreciating tea as a mindful experience that far extends simply drinking tea. Slip into nostalgic ambiance of our historical architecture, relax to traditional classical Chinese music and experience the gentle hustle

reviews.text: Such a well hidden gem! From the moment you stepped in, puts u in a zen mood. Shoes are kept away in their shoe racks. Staff is accommodating and friendly. Unique experience for me, cause its my first Tea House. Very clean and neat. Good selection of teas and snacks. They allow you to have a slot for 2 hours. Definitely coming back here!

Took up the Tea Appreciation session and it was a great experience for my husband and I. Had the chance to learn abt the history of tea and China, the different types of tea and their benefits, hands on session of tea drinking... Thoroughly enjoyed ourselves on the 1-1 experience! We will come back for tea drinking and catch up with friends and family for sure. Highly recommended.

Was surprised by the amount of cultured human beings on earth when i reach here. The short 7 minutes introduction was very educational, sufficient to make me a cultured singaporean. May get too thirsty due to small teapot size for brewing. But overall, i really love this place, the ambience and their tea is extremely good. Will be back again to practice my patience.

Love the place,a small shop house located along the bustling street in Chinatown.
Great place to hang out with friends and even alone to enjoy the tranquil and calming environment as you put your mind at ease while being educated and trying out the difference variety of tea leaves they have to offer as while as the intricacies of drinking tea.
Must try activity.

Nice and quiet tea house. Plenty of Chinese tea to choose from. Bear in mind the $9/pax min spending and 2hr time limitation. $5 additional for Korean and oriental styled tea room, $10 additional for the bigger room. Japanese style area is not chargeable since it has no partition and no curtain. First timer can request for demo.

data.description: Appreciating traditional Chinese tea beyond the hustle and bustle of Singapore
data.name: Tea Chapter Trading Pte. Ltd.

data.body: This stall serves the popular Hakka Chinese dish in many other ways.

reviews.text: Great food. Super cosy vibe. I've been here since like 2015 or 2016. It's awesome. Keep it up! 👍🏼

Located at a quaint corner, easy to spot and a lot of parking space available nearby. The Yong Tau Foo ingredient selection is good, but the soup is what makes this place special. Try out the condiments provided as well, you'll quickly learn why this place is highly rated. Highly recommended to go.
The lady who helped was very polite and patient with my incessant questions (being a newbie). She was very knowledgeable. It would be a pleasure to visit the place again. Thank you!
You want good halal Yong Tau Foo? This is the place to be! Food presented well at all times!
Had bee hood with cai Poh sauce. Food is average, not savory but filling. Healthy choice for those who likes blend food. Option for meat is limited. It's ex for Yong Tau Foo.

data.description: This stall serves the popular Hakka Chinese dish in many other ways.
data.name: Jason Niang Dou Fu

data.body: A Chinese restaurant that's popular for its affordable, fuss-free food.

reviews.text: Myriad choices of China-Singapore chinese dishes in Kampong Glam, worth trying, reasonably priced
Good food at affordable. No service charge n gst charge. No MSG in food.

Reasonable price and good taste.
Also beer price is reasonable.

Still affordable and tasty set lunches (used to be $5.50 but now $6) that comes with a tzechar dish (e.g. sweet sour pork, kung po chicken, salted egg chicken, etc...), a rice, a soup, and a Chinese tea.

I have tried the sweet sour pork, kung po chicken, Chong Qing Spicy Chicken (重慶辣子雞丁), and the Salted Egg Chicken; they are very flavorful. The Chong Qing Spicy Chicken is a popular choice among diners here.

Authentic Chinese cooked food by china chef (based on their accent).  Enjoy every dishes i ordered. Fried Rice, Xiao Long Bao, Lou Mee, Mushroom Fish Noodle.  Price is reasonable and lots of return customers.

data.description: A Chinese restaurant that's popular for its affordable, fuss-free food.
data.name: North South Cuisine

data.body: JING is a contemporary Chinese restaurant represented by Cantonese and Singapore influences. Using top grade internationally sourced seasonal ingredients in timeless dishes, guests can expect to be served in a modern, understated space with opulent touches overseeing the beautiful waterfront at Marina Bay.

reviews.text: We have the lunch buffet at the promotional price. The food is good and the service staffs are approachable, fast and efficient! Great job guys! We really enjoyed the lunch!

The food was better than expected. Agree that it's good value too as they were quite generous. Maybe except the fish, it doesn't look like a 800g as charged. The scallop broccoli was fantastic. Over of them best I've tried. The fried rice is really unique with the fish roe adding some crunch.
Very pricey but for the good service, it's worth it. The food is very tasty, and presented very well. Definitely will come back and try other dishes in their menu.

Extremely pleased with our experience at Jing Seafood Restaurant last night. Waitress was attentive throughout the dinner, food was served very promptly, very fresh and piping hot. View of the bay was awesome. Best of all, the price is really very reasonable. Dad had a good birthday celebration there! Thumbs up!

it serves many crab foods, which are representing food in Singapore.
Not only the food is great, but also services and kindness of waiters are excellent. Mood of the restaurant doesn’t have doubt to believe it’s an ordinary restaurant in Singapore. To be honest food was great but they were felt like not fresh enough it doesn't really matter tho.
Everything was nice :>

data.description: JING is a contemporary Chinese restaurant represented by Cantonese and Singapore influences.
data.name: Jing Seafood Restaurant

data.body: Puncak is a Halal eatery that specialises in Chinese cuisine. Some of their popular dishes include Honeydew Chicken Noodle, Wanton Noodles and Claypot Rice. Locals boast about their Fried Wonton, served piping hot and coated with a crispy yellow outer layer. Dip it in mayonnaise and sweet black soya sauce for added oomph.

reviews.text: OMGGGG THE HONEYDEW CHICKEN IS SO GOOOD! it is the best i have ever eaten. melts in your mouth. the staff is so nice too. everyone eat here!!
Loved the food.. been there for more than 2 decades.. quality and taste remains the same.. always full house
Cheap and good. One of the best Beef Fried Rice around
My all time favourite spot in town. To makan
Good food. Tummy very happy.

data.description: Indulge in a Halal Chinese cuisine only at Puncak, which serves delicious and piping hot dishes.
data.name: Puncak

data.body: Satisfy your sweet tooth at Mei Heong Yuen Dessert. This joint specialises in traditional Chinese desserts such as bird’s nest soup and yam paste, but you could also opt for other treats like durian mochi and one of their snow ice creations (which come in an array of flavours, from lychee to green tea). Other highlights include warm Chinese desserts like peanut and black sesame pastes, or the classic mango puree with pomelo and sago offering a welcome respite from our warm tropical weather.

reviews.text:
Had a lousy service experience here. The manager/owner happily let us queue & make orders, despite the store is closing in less then 8 minutes time. We only know this from the servicing staff later when they are doing closing. Shocked us too.

Had another family with an elderly with similar experience. Poor ah gong ends up having to rush his food like the war time.

If the place going to close soon, is a respectful thing to sound it out to the customer. Not just stay quiet & take money.

On food, best just take the hot dessert. Cold dessert like shaved ice, mostly are just ice. Not much ingredient and taste.
Overall amazing experience, would definitely head back again. Service was great! They were really friendly and assisted us well (as it was our first time there).
Nice dessert.  Wide varieties to be choose from. Love the ambience. Quiet and not so much people around when we have decided to pay a visit to enjoy our hot dessert.
The main shop of the chain, highly recommend the mango roll, its really good.

Ah Balling Tang Yuan (SGD $3.20) @ Mei Heong Yuen Dessert.
.
With a 50-year history behind them, this chain serves reliably decent traditional desserts.
.
The large glutinous rice balls have pink or white hues to indicate the type of filling within. It's soft and chewy and sticky, and the filling is generous.
.
The black sesame paste has a coarse creamy texture with an earthy sweet nutty taste, while the peanut paste has a fine chunky texture with a nutty sweet flavour.
.
The ginger soup tends to the sweet side, with the warming spice notes to complement.

data.description: A local heritage brand specialising in selling a variety of hot and cold Chinese desserts
data.name: Mei Heong Yuen Dessert (Temple Street Outlet)

data.body: Visitors seeking authentic hawker fare in a more refined setting should head to StraitsKitchen at Grand Hyatt Singapore, Singapore’s first SG Clean Quality Mark hotel. Smart casual dress code applies. This restaurant serves a sumptuous buffet spread of local favourites (lunch: S$62++; dinner: S$72++), including dishes of the Peranakans (Straits-born people of Chinese and Malay/Indonesian heritage), Chinese and Indian cuisine, and popular hawker staples such as satay (grilled meat skewers), laksa (spicy coconut milk-based noodle soup) and chicken rice, all in a chic steel-and-marble dining hall. For dessert, the freshly made nonya kueh (bite-sized snacks or desserts) and homemade ice creams are not to be missed at StraitsKitchen. Child rates available.

reviews.text: Average local food served in a hotel. Can get better cooking at the local restaurants / cafe. Was disappointed when I saw that the cakes they served for dessert is from a local bakery (taken straight out from the bakery box to the buffet table!) and not baked by the hotel's baker. Was crowded but the staff did a good job trying their best to clear the dishes etc

Straits Kitchen is a buffet setting with many varieties of Asian dishes to choose from. Love the ambience and the food taste great. The staffs were helpful, courteous, friendly and attentive. Halal certified and Highly recommended!

Oh Straits Kitchen What Is There NOT TO Love About This Place…

Can’t Recall A Time Went The Food & Service Has Not Met My Expectation.

Be It Breakfast, Lunch Or Dinner.. The Food Is Always Fantastic & VERY FRESH

Some managers there need to educate themselves. Showing their unprofessionalism and not knowing how to talk to customers is ruining the whole dining experience despite paying the hefty amount.
Ordering any drink from the table just take ages to come or will never come. Indian food and Malay food is good but Chinese food is below average.The dessert choices were also very limited.
This is long-overdue! I had my birthday celebration here and we really enjoyed ourselves! The food was fantastic! Thank you!

data.description: Enjoy a sumptuous buffet spread of local delights ranging from Peranakan to Chinese to Indian dishes at this chic restaurant.
data.name: StraitsKitchen

data.body: Tucked between Ann Siang and Erskine Road is one of Singapore’s most famous handmade Chinese pastry shops, Tong Heng. The  bakery offers signature melt-in-your-mouth diamond shaped egg tarts. Other must-try traditional pastries include Baked Pork Bun and Wife Pastry (a traditional Cantonese flaky pastry with sweet filling), refreshing Chinese desserts like Chilled Rose Peach Gum, Warm Almond Soup, and many others. It also offers a wide selection of delicious cookies in beautifully designed tins or jars of fragrant kaya (a traditional jam made from coconut and eggs).

reviews.text: Best egg tarts around! Flavours are dense and the sweetness is light which gratefully doesn’t over power the fluffy egg custard. Crust is light with a light saltiness which gives it a beautiful contrast to the egg custard. Packed beautifully in gift-quality boxes that hold them securely in place to be enjoyed by all.

Soft crust egg tarts, it's way different texture from many other egg tart brands. Worth the try and many more tries.

Good for souvenirs to relatives and friends
i love their egg tarts w coconut on top!! simply amazing. a favourite since young :)

Beautiful pastries and love the variety. We got a salted egg yolk red bean pastry and black sesame cake at 7pm on a Sunday. It might have been a bit stale from sitting out so it tasted dry and flaky, but I think there was potential
Too sweet for my liking.  Only comfort was the crust was crispy (only because it was freshly made).  A bit pricey

data.description: A traditional Chinese bakery known for their diamond shaped egg tarts, which has been in business since the 1930s.
data.name: Tong Heng

data.body: 藝 yì, which stands for art in the Chinese language, references centuries of culinary mastery to bring the best in the fine art of Chinese dining. The classy restaurant features artistic adaptations of provincial cuisine from all the different regions of China. The restaurant brings guests on an exploration to China’s diverse cultural regions with dishes incorporating single sourced and seasonal ingredients with a contemporary approach. Its signature dish, the Hundred-ring Cucumber with Sea Whelk, is skilfully sliced and served with refreshing vinaigrette and sea whelk—presenting a refreshing experience for visitors’ taste buds. Allergens and dietary specifications are highlighted in the menu and staff will able to assist with any dietary requirements.

reviews.text: Beautiful and modern Chinese restaurant I have visited in Singapore. We went there for lunch and ordered 2 different lunch sets. Every dishes are impeccable and delicious. There is only 1 dish that is not to my liking which is the beef soup noodle. The noodle was a tad too soft when it was served. I would prefer the noodle to be slightly chewy so it complements well with the beef. Other than that, the staff service and food is good. Would definitely visit again for a la carte options.
It’s a great experience. The ambiance is very welcoming and charming. Interior is beautifully decorated. Staff are extremely knowledgeable and make great recommendations.
The set up of the place is very pretty. Pao fan was the best, however I wouldn’t say the same about the duck. The XLB was good.

Food is very delicious. The fried rice seems a bit pricey for a fried rice at first but it is so good and with good portion size that is enough for 2-3 pax. Also recommend the fried fish appetizer that is served with fermented Chinese cabbage.
The interior design is totally my cup of tea, I believe it’s 新中式, modern Chinese style.
Staffs are very friendly and attentive too!

It's hard to find one dish that's not delicious in Yi. The chef really put his heart into creating every piece of the menu. The ambience and the service is great, the value for money is outstanding. Highly recommended.

data.pricing: Á la carte menu prices vary
